snippet: The Fed’s 2013 Survey of Consumer Finances indicates that the median family headed by someone under 35 was paid less, in inflation-adjusted dollars, than a similar family in 1989.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column; 2013 Survey of Consumer Finances shows that families headed by someone under 35 years of age had lower median income, adjusted for inflation; survey is conducted every three years by Federal Reserve.
lead_paragraph: The Fed’s 2013 Survey of Consumer Finances indicates that the median family headed by someone under 35 was paid less, in inflation-adjusted dollars, than a similar family in 1989.

headline.print_headline: Young Households, Even Educated Ones, Lose Ground in Income
headline.main: Young Households Are Losing Ground in Income, Despite Education
